section.para: The zones element collects all zones defined within the codeplug. It is just a list of zone definitions. Each zone has an ID, name and one or two lists of channels. One for VFO A and one for VFO B. Depending on the radio, a zone will be split automatically into two zones if the radio handles separate zones for each VFO.
As an example, consider the following zone:

example.title: Zone definition
example.programlisting: zones: - id: zone1 name: KW A: [ch1, ch4, ch5, ch2, ch6, ch11, ch12, ch13, ch15, ch16, ch76, ch77, ch78, ch79] B: [ch97, ch101, ch102, ch103, ch68, ch69, ch70, ch71, ch72, ch73, ch74, ch75]

section.para: This zone has the name KW and contains two lists of channels. One for each VFO. On radios, where each VFO is assigned a zone individually, this zone will be split into two: KW A and KW B to match the radios configuration.

listitem.para: Specifies the ID of the zone. For now, there are no codeplug elements that refer to zones.
Specifies the name of the zone. Any string is valid here.
Specifies the channel list for VFO A. This must be a list of references to channels.
Optional channel list for VFO B. If present, must be a list of references to channels.
